His thin, worn, sallow face was covered with deep wrinkles, which always looked as clean and well washed as the tips of one's fingers after a Russian bath. The movement of these wrinkles formed the principal play of expression on his face. Now his forehead would pucker into deep folds and his eyebrows were lifted, then his eye- brows would descend and deep wrinkles would crease his cheeks. His small, deep-set eyes al- ways twinkled and looked out straight.
